summary:
I lead - and participate in – transdisciplinary* scientific teams. I do this on topics that address wicked societal problems that require improved human performance. I am currently leading an Early Research Program on cultivating wisdom in policy making: A topic that requires many disciplines to come together in order to create new ways of thinking and novel solutions.

I am also a member of the corporate core team for systemsinnovations at TNO. This team has been established in April 2022 to implement our ambition to improve our capability to offer systemsinnovations. The core team strives towards developing a methodology on how to put systems thinking into practice that is fitted for our field of applied research. This includes setting up a community of practice and developing the content of training and coaching facilities. 

My fascination with uncertainty
I want to understand what drives us humans to strive for growth, develop our mindset, and enrich our perspective. It is my conviction that a society worth pursuing starts with people that cultivate their innate potential to think and act wisely. In my perspective, cultivating this wisdom comes with the ability to tolerate uncertainty. I am on a continuous quest to find out what it takes to tolerate the discomfort of not-knowing and not understanding. I believe wisdom comes forth from curiosity and wonder, and I think it is hindered by polarization and intolerance. I believe this ability to accept and embrace uncertainty, and to work and progress from there, is the key to transdisciplinary research. I am developing and cultivating the skills and mindset that are needed for transdisciplinary research both in myself and in my research teams.

*Transdisciplinarity occurs when two or more perspectives transcend each other to form a new holistic approach. The outcome will be different from what one would expect from the addition of the parts.

projects.title: Effectief Beinvloeden: Reflect & Switch
projects.description: De inzet van de Nederlandse krijgsmacht vindt plaats in missiegebieden met een grote diversiteit aan actoren, waarmee moet worden samengewerkt en afgestemd. Recente missies hebben laten zien dat het realiseren van (militaire) doelstellingen in sterke mate afhankelijk is van het vermogen om het gedrag van deze actoren effectief te beïnvloeden.  Voor defensie is het van belang om dit vermogen bij haar militairen te versterken evident. Vanuit deze vraag richt het onderzoeksproject ‘ Beinvloeden’ zich op het ontwikkelen van tools en (trainings)methodieken ter verbetering van de ‘beïnvloedings-skills’ van de individuele militair.

projects.title: Training Coping flexibiliteit
projects.description: Militairen worden tijdens militaire operaties geconfronteerd met veel stressvolle omstandigheden. Snel wisselende omstandigheden, heftige gevechtsacties, maar ook verveling, fysieke uitputting en frustratie kunnen een grote belasting zijn voor de individuele militair. Om de operationele effectiviteit en het voortzettingsvermogen te vergroten en de uitval van militairen tijdens de militaire loopbaan te verminderen zijn mentaal veerkrachtige militairen nodig die stressvolle omstandigheden weten te incasseren en hier snel van kunnen herstellen.Hoe mensen met stressvolle situaties omgaan is van persoon tot persoon verschillend. Wat de beste manier is om met deze veranderingen om te gaan, verschilt ook van situatie tot situatie. Van belang is dat je in elke situatie die manier van omgaan kiest die op dat moment het beste is en kunt schakelen tussen wat je op dat moment denkt of doet. Dit noemen we coping flexibiliteit. Door de coping flexibiliteit effectief te ontwikkelen kan de mentale veerkracht van de militair worden vergroot.TNO doet in opdracht van defensie onderzoek naar hoe je zo effectief mogelijk coping flexibiliteit kan trainen. Hierbij ligt de focus op militaire commandanten, juist omdat zij een belangrijke rol kunnen spelen in het versterken van de mentale veerkracht van hun eigen eenheid.

projects.title: Adaptivity in Modern Military Operations
projects.description: De adaptiviteit van de individuele militair blijkt een cruciale factor te zijn in het vergroten van de operationele effectiviteit en het voortzettingsvemogen tijdens uitzendingen. De complexiteit waardoor moderne militaire missies worden gekenmerkt vereist dat de militair in staat is zich te bewegen in veranderlijke en onvoorspelbare omgevingen en dat hij zich snel kan aanpassen aan steeds veranderende taken, doelstellingen en omstandigheden. Hij moet alert zijn op de (veranderende) omgeving en inzicht hebben in zijn eigen vermogen hiermee om te gaan. De eindeisen van defensie zijn duidelijk: moderne militaire missies vergen optimaal adaptieve militairen. Het self-development center AMMO wordt de digitale omgeving die de ontwikkeling van militaire adaptiviteit gedurende de gehele loopbaan ondersteunt

profile_positions.description:
In the midst of a pandemic and heading towards the largest economic recession since the 1930’s, the demands on policy-makers and government officials are extremely high. Many of the policy options in a crisis are ‘wicked’ in nature: The complexity of issues is overwhelming, the potential side effects unclear, and the arena’s in which the policy discussions take place are ambiguous and volatile. 

Policymaking that accounts for the wellbeing of our society, now and in the future, is essential to effectively manage the radical changes of the current crisis, and the crises to come. There are, however, currently only few and partial instruments available to assess the expected impact on wellbeing prospectively. Unlike amounts of money, wellbeing is considered more difficult to translate into data that can be easily compared. This is complicated even further when trying to compare conflicting forms of wellbeing (like ‘privacy’ versus ‘safety’). Another hurdle that is recognized in policymaking, is that the policy making process is characterized by insufficient attention and guidance towards unbiased dialogue and towards creating consensus among multiple stakeholders, citizens, and other involved participants. With a lack of solid and reliable data on the effects of policy options on wellbeing, adverse effects of cognitive biases and vested interests in policy discussions are imminent. 

This ERP aims to fill this gap. Our aim is to develop a suite of instruments and methods to support policy makers to assess the impacts of policy options on wellbeing (ex-ante). And to engage in unbiased and well-informed dialogue leading to decisions that prioritize sustainable societal wellbeing.

profile_positions.description:
Project Lead “Adaptive Defence Organisation”
Strategic partner in providing scientific support for the organisation-wide initiative of the Dutch Defence Organization to enhance its adaptability. The focus of our support is on enhancing an ambidextrous mindset in the organisation. We offer the insights gained through extensive research on the mechanisms in the organisation that facilitate and hamper adaptability. We also develop, test and renew methods to enhance an ambidextrous mindset in strategic military leaders.
profile_positions.title: Project lead Adaptive Armed Forces

profile_positions.description:
The Dutch Defence Organization wishes to optimize the adaptivity of its employees ánd its organisation. The complexity of the working field has only increased due to huge variations in -and unpredictability of-  missions, theaters, involved parties, political situations, actors, etc. 

The objective of this research program is to gain insight in individual adaptivity of the defense employees, the adaptivity of the defense organization as a whole ánd the interaction between these two. Our aim is to obtain insights with which future military operations and military readiness can be optimized.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager "Human & Organisational Adaptivity"

profile_positions.description:
Develop knowledge, insights, methods, and tools that harness the wisdom in policymaking, i.e.:  to contribute to sustainable future societies that are both prosperous and fair, allowing individuals and communities to flourish and be happy.
The ultimate goal of policymaking is to guide society in the direction of a common future that is worth pursuing. Policies are not dictated by policymakers—instead, they are shaped by translating the values, beliefs, and actions of citizens.  Pursuing wise policy, then, equates to seeking wisdom in society, through its people, and through the institutions that bind them.
The Early Research Program Wise Policymaking explores wisdom at different angles: by establishing how to determine what goals a wise society (‘Wise Society’) should pursue, by enhancing the wisdom of Individuals (‘Wise Humans’), by promoting wise institutions (‘Wise Institutions’), and by advancing models that support decision-making (‘Wise Choice Models’). Theoretical and practical insights and methods will be validated in three topical case studies (‘Wise Experiments’). 
The transdisciplinary approach that this ERP requires, will be designed, tested and refined while carrying out the research. The aim of this research team is to grow towards true transdisciplinarity. The objective of transdisciplinary research is to understand the present world, in all of its complexities, instead of focusing on one part of it (Nicolescu, 1997)”. It entails the ability to deeply integrate and transcend disciplinary approaches to generate fundamentally new conceptual frameworks, theories, models, and applications.”  (Cooke and Hilton (eds.), 2015, p.23).

Project Manager Scientific Research TNO "High Performance Empowerment". 
Research and implementation of innovative training solutions to empower  mental, cognitive and emotional capacity in order to support high performances under demanding circumstances. Covered research-topics include competence-management for top-leadership in a comprehensive approach, junior leadership in relation to preventing moral disengagement and PPP (presence posture profile), adaptibility, mental resilience, ad hoc team effectiveness and mental mission preparation.
